qas.question: The city of Montevideo has an average elevation of what?
How far is to the neighboring capitol of San Jose de Mayo?
How far is to the neighboring capitol of Canelones?

context: The city has an average elevation of <a0_0>43 metres<a0_0/> (141 ft). Its highest elevations are two hills: the Cerro de Montevideo and the Cerro de la Victoria, with the highest point, the peak of Cerro de Montevideo, crowned by a fortress, the Fortaleza del Cerro at a height of 134 metres (440 ft). Closest cities by road are Las Piedras to the north and the so-called Ciudad de la Costa (a conglomeration of coastal towns) to the east, both in the range of 20 to 25 kilometres (16 mi) from the city center. The approximate distances to the neighbouring department capitals by road are, <a1_0>90 kilometres<a1_0/> (56 mi) to San Jose de Mayo (San Jose Department) and <a2_0>46 kilometres<a2_0/> (29 mi) to Canelones (Canelones Department).
